short_summary: Maintain and enhance Pacific Region Commercial, Recreational and Indigenous fisheries information management systems.
description: The project requires application development services to maintain and enhance the systems for managing fisheries data in the Pacific Region. The services include database management, software development, and testing. The project aims to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of fisheries data management and reporting.
full_summary:
===============

**Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) Pacific Region Commercial, Recreational and Indigenous Fisheries Information Systems Tender Notice**

Title:
-------

**English:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) Pacific Region Commercial, Recreational and Indigenous Fisheries Information Systems
**French:** Système d’information sur les pêches commerciales, récréatives et autochtones de la région du Pacifique de Pêches et Océans Canada (MPO)

**Tender Details**
-------------------

* Reference Number: CB-602-40637378
* Amendment Number: 8
* Solicitation Number: 30004968 TBIPS - KREST
* Publication Date: 2024-02-07
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-27 14:00:00

**Notice Information**
---------------------

* Trade Agreements: Various, including the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), and Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: British Columbia
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective Tendering

**Statement of Work**
---------------------

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers for the provision of information management systems for its Pacific Region. The successful supplier will be required to:

* Maintain and enhance existing fisheries information systems, including KREST, NRLS, and NSLIS
* Develop and implement new application development services to support ongoing demands for data integration, management, and advanced reporting functionalities
* Provide a fully functional and tested Common Template and associated application to support DFO’s data management and reporting needs

**Evaluation Criteria**
---------------------

The proposals will be evaluated based on the supplier’s technical capacity and experience in providing comparable services, as well as their proposed solution’s innovation, flexibility, and value for money.

**Submission Information**
-------------------------

The tender documents are available on the Canada Buys website. Proposals must be submitted electronically by the closing date.

**Contact Information**
----------------------

For further information, please contact:

Bassam EL-DAYA
Fisheries and Oceans Canada
Phone: (343) 571-6911
Email: [bassam.el-daya@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:bassam.el-daya@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)  # Rewrite of the text
